cryptosuite.description: An identifier for the cryptographic suite that can be used to verify the proof.

proofPurpose.description: The reason the proof was created.

proofValue.description: Contains the base-encoded binary data necessary to verify the digital proof using the verificationMethod specified.

verificationMethod.description: The verification method of the proof.

created.description: The iso date of when the proof was created.

expires.description: The iso date of when the proof expires.

domain.description: One or more security domains in which the proof is meant to be used.

challenge.description: Provided to mitigate replay attacks on domains.

previousProof.description: Identifies another data integrity proof that MUST verify before the current proof is processed

nonce.description: Use of this field is to increase privacy by decreasing linkability that is the result of deterministically generated signatures.

description: Interface describing a did proof. https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-data-integrity/
